```{r}
## Library packages 
library(tidyverse)

library(here)
library(janitor)
```

## function for recoding education
```{r}
## function for recoding education
recode_education <- function(df, educ_var) {
  educ_var <- enquo(educ_var)
  df <- df  %>%
    mutate(educ = !!educ_var) %>%
    mutate(educ_yrs = case_when(
      educ == 2 ~ 0,
      educ == 12 ~ 0,
      educ == 14 ~ 1,
      educ == 15 ~ 2,
      educ == 16 ~ 3,
      educ == 17 ~ 4,
      educ == 22 ~ 5,
      educ == 23 ~ 6,
      educ == 25 ~ 7,
      educ == 26 ~ 8,
      educ == 30 ~ 9,
      educ == 40 ~ 10,
      educ == 50 ~ 11,
      educ == 60 ~ 12,
      educ == 70 ~ 13,
      educ == 80 ~ 14,
      educ == 90 ~ 15,
      educ == 100 ~ 16,
      educ == 110 ~ 17,
      educ == 111 ~ 17,
      educ == 112 ~ 17,
      educ == 113 ~ 17
    ))

  return(df)
}
```


#read in numident
```{r}
## read in numident 
#numident <- fread("~mariaosborne-ipums/censoc_weights/data/data_for_release/datafiles_with_raking_adj/censoc_numident_v3.csv") %>% 
#  janitor::clean_names()
numident <- fread("/data/censoc/censoc_data_releases/censoc_numident/censoc_numident_v3/censoc_numident_v3.csv") %>% 
  janitor::clean_names()
## read in 1940 census 
census_1940 <- fread("/ipums-repo2022/1940/TSV/P.tsv", select = c("HISTID", "SERIALP", "AGE", "INCWAGE", "SEX", "EDUC", "RACE", "RELATE", "REGION", "MARST", "SEI")) %>% 
  janitor::clean_names()
## read in 1940 census household
census_1940_h <- fread("/ipums-repo2022/1940/TSV/H.tsv", select = c("SERIAL", "STATEFIP", "OWNERSHP", "URBAN", "REGION")) %>% 
  janitor::clean_names()
```


#Linking the data
```{r}
## combine census person and household vars 
census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940 %>% 
  inner_join(census_1940_h, by = c("serialp" = "serial"))

## add on numident  
census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  left_join(numident, by = "histid")

# drop women (sex.x == sex.y always)
census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  filter(sex.x == 1)

## recode education variable to years of education
census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  recode_education(educ_var = educ)
## read data dictionary initiative (DDI) file with varnames and var labels 
ipums_ddi <- ipumsr::read_ipums_ddi("/ipums-repo2019-1/fullcount.ddi.xml")
## add on ipums value + variable labels  
census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  janitor::clean_names(case = "all_caps") %>% 
  ipumsr::ipums_collect(ipums_ddi, var_attrs = c("val_labels", "var_label", "var_desc")) %>% 
  janitor::clean_names()
```


# remove big intermediary files
```{r}
rm(census_1940)
rm(census_1940_h)
rm(numident)
gc()
```


#Recode variables
```{r}
census_1940_hh_vars_recode <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  mutate(match_conservative = case_when(
    !is.na(byear) ~ "Matched",
    TRUE ~ "Unmatched"
  ),
  hs = case_when(
    educ >= 60 & educ < 998 ~ 1,
    TRUE ~ 0
  ), 
  rural = case_when(
    urban == 1 ~ 1,
    TRUE ~ 0
  ),
  black = case_when( 
    race == 200 ~ 1,
    TRUE ~ 0
  ), white = case_when(
    race == 100 ~ 1,
    TRUE ~ 0
  ),
  homeown = case_when(
    ownershp == 10 ~ 1, 
    TRUE ~ 0
  ),
  p_hh_head = case_when(
    relate == 101 ~ 1, 
    TRUE ~ 0
  ),
  p_hh_head = case_when(
    relate == 101 ~ 1, 
    TRUE ~ 0
  ),
  educ_level = case_when(
    educ <= 50 ~ "< High School",
    educ %in% 60:90 ~ "High School or some college",
    educ %in% 100 ~ "Bachelors Degree",
    educ %in% 110:116 ~ "Advanced Degree"
  ), 
  sei_recode = case_when(
    sei %in% 1:9 ~ "sei_1_9",
    sei %in% 10:14 ~ "sei_10_14",
    sei %in% 15:25 ~ "sei_15_25",
    sei >= 26 ~      "sei_26+"
  ),
  marital_status = case_when(
      marst %in% 1:2 ~ "married",
      TRUE ~ "not married" ),
  race_recode = case_when(
    race == 100 ~ "White",
    race == 200 ~ "Black",
    TRUE ~ "Other"
  ))
```

# more recoding, filter to select cohorts
```{r}
census_1940_hh_vars_recode <- census_1940_hh_vars_recode %>% 
  mutate(rural = case_when(
    rural == 1 ~ "Rural",
    TRUE ~ "Urban"
  ),
  homeown = case_when(
    homeown == 1 ~ "Home Owner",
    TRUE ~ "Not Home Owner"
  ),
  region_string = as_factor(region)) %>% 
  filter(age %in% 20:40)
```



# tabulations
```{r}

## tabulations for selected sex in 1940 census 
census_characteristics <- census_1940_hh_vars_recode %>% 
  select(histid, race_recode, educ_level, sei_recode, marital_status, region_string, rural, homeown) %>%
  pivot_longer(-histid) %>% 
  group_by(name, value) %>%
  tally() %>%            
  mutate(prop = round(100*prop.table(n), 1)) %>% 
  rename(n_gen = n, prop_gen = prop)

## tabulations for sex in CenSoc-Numident conservative 
unweighted_numident_characteristics_conservative <- census_1940_hh_vars_recode %>% 
  filter(match_conservative == "Matched") %>% 
  select(histid, race_recode, educ_level, sei_recode, marital_status, region_string, rural, homeown) %>%
  pivot_longer(-histid) %>% 
  group_by(name, value) %>%
  tally() %>%            
  mutate(prop = round(100*prop.table(n), 1)) %>% 
  rename(n_numi_conservative = n, prop_numi_conservative = prop)

# weighted totals/proportions
weighted_numident_characteristics_conservative <- census_1940_hh_vars_recode %>% 
  filter(match_conservative == "Matched") %>% 
  filter(!is.na(weight)) %>% 
  select(histid, race_recode, educ_level, sei_recode,
         marital_status, region_string, rural, homeown, weight) %>%
  pivot_longer(-c(histid, weight)) %>% 
  group_by(name, value) %>% 
  count(wt = weight) %>% 
  group_by(name) %>% 
  mutate(prop = n/sum(n)) %>% 
  mutate(prop = round(100*prop, 1)) %>% 
  rename(n_numi_conservative_weighted = n, prop_numi_conservative_weighted = prop)
  

# join and relevel some factors so they'll show up in order
unweighted_combined_characteristics <- census_characteristics %>% 
  inner_join(unweighted_numident_characteristics_conservative, by = c("name", "value")) %>% 
  mutate(name = as.factor(name), value = as.factor(value)) %>% 
  mutate(name = factor(name, levels = c("educ_level", "race_recode", "marital_status", "homeown", "sei_recode", "rural", "region_string"))) %>% 
  arrange(name, value) 

weighted_combined_characteristics <- census_characteristics %>% 
  inner_join(weighted_numident_characteristics_conservative, by = c("name", "value")) %>% 
  mutate(name = as.factor(name), value = as.factor(value)) %>% 
  mutate(name = factor(name, levels = c("educ_level", "race_recode", "marital_status", "homeown", "sei_recode", "rural", "region_string"))) %>% 
  arrange(name, value) 

# create difference in percent columns
unweighted_combined_characteristics <- unweighted_combined_characteristics %>% 
  mutate(difference_in_proportions_unweighted = prop_numi_conservative - prop_gen)

weighted_combined_characteristics <- weighted_combined_characteristics %>% 
  mutate(difference_in_proportions_weighted = prop_numi_conservative_weighted - prop_gen)
```



## create table 
## will have to do some manual clean-up but this gets us 80% of the way
```{r}
combined_characteristics <- left_join(unweighted_combined_characteristics
                                  %>% select(-c(difference_in_proportions_unweighted)),
                                  weighted_combined_characteristics %>% 
                                    select(name, value, prop_numi_conservative_weighted, difference_in_proportions_weighted),
                                  by = c("name", "value"))


combined_characteristics <- combined_characteristics %>% select(name, value,
                                      n_numi_conservative, n_gen,
                                      prop_numi_conservative, prop_numi_conservative_weighted,
                                      prop_gen, difference_in_proportions_weighted)

# rename variables to look nicer
for_table <- combined_characteristics %>% 
  mutate(name = case_when(name == "educ_level" ~ "Education",
                          name == "marital_status" ~ "Marital Status",
                          name == "race_recode" ~ "Race",
                          name == "region_string" ~ "Region",
                          name == "rural" ~ "Rural",
                          name == "sei_recode" ~ "Socioeconomic Index",
                          name == "homeown" ~ "Home Ownership"))
  
# get rid of "division"
for_table$value<-gsub("Division","",for_table$value)
for_table$value<-gsub("Div.","",for_table$value)

# table
table_s3_s <- gt(data = for_table) %>% 
  tab_spanner(
    label = "Count",
    columns = c(n_numi_conservative, n_gen)) %>% 
  tab_spanner(
    label = "Proportion (%)",
    columns = c(prop_numi_conservative, prop_numi_conservative_weighted, prop_gen)) %>% 
  tab_spanner(
    label = "Difference (%)",
    columns = c(difference_in_proportions_weighted)) %>% 
  cols_label(
    "n_gen" = "1940 Census",
    "prop_gen" = "1940 Census",
    "n_numi_conservative"  = "CenSoc-Numident",
    "prop_numi_conservative" = "CenSoc-Numident (unweighted)",
    "prop_numi_conservative_weighted" = "CenSoc-Numident (weighted)",
    "difference_in_proportions_weighted" = "Weighted CenSoc-Numident - Census",
    value = ""
  ) %>% 
  fmt_number(
    columns = c(n_gen, n_numi_conservative),
     use_seps = TRUE,
    decimals = 0
  ) %>% 
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_text(weight = "bold")),
    locations = cells_row_groups()
  ) %>% 
  opt_row_striping(row_striping = T) %>% 
  cols_align("left") 

table_s3_s

```
